Jahnel Group’s mission is to provide the absolute best environment for software creators to pursue their passion by connecting them with great clients doing meaningful work. We get to build some of the most complex and compelling applications for our clients located across the country.

We’re a fast-growing INC 5000 recognized company, yet we still work as a very close-knit team (100+ employees). We’re growing like crazy, and if you’re looking for the next place to call home, hit us up for a beer or coffee.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

We are looking to hire a Development and Operations Engineer. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software engineering and will employ DevOps tools and best practices to improve our development team’s production.

Problem-solving is key with the ability to utilize creative and innovative thinking. Rather than include the same old boring job description, here is a list of tasks the prospective employee may be asked to accomplish and/or attributes the candidate should possess.

Primary Responsibilities:
Work with multiple cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Implement architectural designs and diagrams
Automate processes and systems configuration/deployment
Be able to solve problems and engineer solutions (infrastructure as code)
Troubleshoot production issues and coordinate with the development team to streamline code deployment
Implement automation tools and frameworks (CI/CD)
Analyze code and communicate detailed reviews to development teams
Automate systems tests for security, performance, and availability
Collaborate with team members to improve the company’s engineering tools, policy and procedures, and data security
Ability to gather and aggregate metrics and logs into structured applications
Working knowledge of known tools like Git and GitHub
Some Must-Haves:
5+ Years of Professional Software Development Experience
Expert in continuous code deployment and integration tools (Jenkins, Circle CI, Travis CI, Drone – not all are required, experience with one flavor or another is an absolute must-have)
Expertise with AWS management and proficient in server administration
Experience scripting with Python, Bash, and/or GOlang.
Deep understanding of containers
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship now and in the future
Where We're Looking For It

Schenectady, New York
100% Remote available for the right candidate

Other Information

The work hours will be approximately 9:00 am to 5:00 pm EST, depending on workload, with the occasional late night when a tight deadline calls for it. We work for security-conscious clients, thus background checks will be required. Salary dependent upon experience.

Position available immediately. How to Apply

Summary
Information and Technology Services (ITS) is looking for a DevOps Applications Admin Intermediate to join the Identify Access Management team with in ITS. You will report to the IAM System Operations Manager. You will be a member of a team responsible managing all Identity Access Management and related systems by collaborating with other IT groups to maintain the IAM infrastructure in a 99.99% uptime production environment.
Who we are:
Information and Technology Services (ITS) supports U-M faculty, researchers, staff, and students in their use of technology to teach, learn, research, and work, and be leaders in their fields. We are dedicated to creating cohesive digital experiences and promoting university wide innovations. ITS's mission is to be trusted enablers of technology for the U-M community. ITS works together to provide cohesive digital experiences and seamless support to the U-M community. For more information about ITS, visit: https://its.umich.edu/about
Responsibilities:
You will oversee the implementation, deployment and support of applications managing the full life cycle of identities; for authentication and authorization and middleware IT service provisioning solutions.
Install, configure, test, maintain software, including Linux-based servers, utilities, system-level software, scripts and custom software applications; develop from source code common open source software such as Apache Web Server, Kerberos, Tomcat and related technologies
Review and monitor systems for availability, error conditions, space allocation, backup integrity and performance to ensure system stability; ensure system backups and data archiving operations and tune performance of production systems
Provide tier two support to ITS departments to resolve problems data integrity issues and the maintenance of the full life cycle of identities
In collaboration with service partners, developers and architects and, as a member of a team, analyze business and user needs and design infrastructure solutions to meet those needs; coordinate and implement IAM infrastructure upgrades and enhancements
Stay current with relevant advances in technologies in authentication systems such as Active Directory NTLM/Kerberos, PKI, Secure Token and Web SSO including federated SSO, to meet the ever-changing needs of the University
Create internal documentation and follow best practices, procedures and share knowledge with team members
Required Qualifications:
A bachelor's degree in computer science, business computing or a related field or equivalent combination of education, certification and experience
Four (4) years' experience in a related role in a large environment requiring confidentiality,, customer service, organization, prioritization, troubleshooting, and analysis to support Red Hat Enterprise and other *nix operating systems
Experience applying appropriate technical tools to perform daily administration tasks, root-cause analysis and service restoration (such as backup, restore, failover, log interpretation and performance monitoring) for Red Hat Enterprise, Ubuntu and other *nix operating systems
Experience writing and debugging Python or Bash scripts for system administration
Knowledge of networking technologies, encryption, VPN, firewall/load balancer technologies
Desired Qualifications:
Hands-on experience of Identity and Access Management and authentication/authorization solutions
Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet or Chef
Experience with Microsoft Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform
Hands-on experience with responsibility for supporting middleware technologies such as: LDAP, Active Directory, SAML2, XML/XDS/XSLT, OpenID
Modern programming skills in any language, including version control, test-driven development and debugging
Experience participating/leading multiple phases of technology infrastructure projects (concept, investigation, deployment, operations, migration, decommission), in particular projects which require coordination with developers and service partners
Experience building and supporting information technology services at a higher education institution
Benefits at the University of Michigan
In addition to a career filled with purpose and opportunity, The University of Michigan offers a comprehensive benefits package to help you stay well, protect yourself and your family and plan for a secure future. Benefits include:
Generous time off
A retirement plan that provides two-for-one matching contributions with immediate vesting
Many choices for comprehensive health insurance
Life insurance
Long-term disability coverage
Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses
Dental and Vision Insurance
Parental and Maternity Leave
Additional Information:
Will require some after-hours/on-call support and reliable internet connectivity.
Underfill Statement
UM- ITS welcomes a healthy applicant pool so we encourage all interested applicants to apply. This position may be underfilled at a lower classification depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.
Application Deadline
Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended.
U-M EEO/AA Statement
The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
U-M COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters when eligible, are required for all University of Michigan students, faculty and staff across all campuses, including Michigan Medicine. This includes those working remotely. More information on this new policy is available on the Campus Blueprint website or the UM-Dearborn and UM-Flint websites.

Summary
Information and Technology Services (ITS) is looking for a DevOps Applications Admin Intermediate to join the Identify Access Management team with in ITS. You will report to the IAM System Operations Manager. You will be a member of a team responsible managing all Identity Access Management and related systems by collaborating with other IT groups to maintain the IAM infrastructure in a 99.99% uptime production environment.
Who we are:
Information and Technology Services (ITS) supports U-M faculty, researchers, staff, and students in their use of technology to teach, learn, research, and work, and be leaders in their fields. We are dedicated to creating cohesive digital experiences and promoting university wide innovations. ITS's mission is to be trusted enablers of technology for the U-M community. ITS works together to provide cohesive digital experiences and seamless support to the U-M community. For more information about ITS, visit: https://its.umich.edu/about
Responsibilities:
You will oversee the implementation, deployment and support of applications managing the full life cycle of identities; for authentication and authorization and middleware IT service provisioning solutions.
Install, configure, test, maintain software, including Linux-based servers, utilities, system-level software, scripts and custom software applications; develop from source code common open source software such as Apache Web Server, Kerberos, Tomcat and related technologies
Review and monitor systems for availability, error conditions, space allocation, backup integrity and performance to ensure system stability; ensure system backups and data archiving operations and tune performance of production systems
Provide tier two support to ITS departments to resolve problems data integrity issues and the maintenance of the full life cycle of identities
In collaboration with service partners, developers and architects and, as a member of a team, analyze business and user needs and design infrastructure solutions to meet those needs; coordinate and implement IAM infrastructure upgrades and enhancements
Stay current with relevant advances in technologies in authentication systems such as Active Directory NTLM/Kerberos, PKI, Secure Token and Web SSO including federated SSO, to meet the ever-changing needs of the University
Create internal documentation and follow best practices, procedures and share knowledge with team members
Required Qualifications:
A bachelor's degree in computer science, business computing or a related field or equivalent combination of education, certification and experience
Four (4) years' experience in a related role in a large environment requiring confidentiality,, customer service, organization, prioritization, troubleshooting, and analysis to support Red Hat Enterprise and other *nix operating systems
Experience applying appropriate technical tools to perform daily administration tasks, root-cause analysis and service restoration (such as backup, restore, failover, log interpretation and performance monitoring) for Red Hat Enterprise, Ubuntu and other *nix operating systems
Experience writing and debugging Python or Bash scripts for system administration
Knowledge of networking technologies, encryption, VPN, firewall/load balancer technologies
Desired Qualifications:
Hands-on experience of Identity and Access Management and authentication/authorization solutions
Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet or Chef
Experience with Microsoft Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform
Hands-on experience with responsibility for supporting middleware technologies such as: LDAP, Active Directory, SAML2, XML/XDS/XSLT, OpenID
Modern programming skills in any language, including version control, test-driven development and debugging
Experience participating/leading multiple phases of technology infrastructure projects (concept, investigation, deployment, operations, migration, decommission), in particular projects which require coordination with developers and service partners
Experience building and supporting information technology services at a higher education institution
Benefits at the University of Michigan
In addition to a career filled with purpose and opportunity, The University of Michigan offers a comprehensive benefits package to help you stay well, protect yourself and your family and plan for a secure future. Benefits include:
Generous time off
A retirement plan that provides two-for-one matching contributions with immediate vesting
Many choices for comprehensive health insurance
Life insurance
Long-term disability coverage
Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses
Dental and Vision Insurance
Parental and Maternity Leave
Additional Information:
Will require some after-hours/on-call support and reliable internet connectivity.
Underfill Statement
UM- ITS welcomes a healthy applicant pool so we encourage all interested applicants to apply. This position may be underfilled at a lower classification depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.
Application Deadline
Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended.
U-M EEO/AA Statement
The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
U-M COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters when eligible, are required for all University of Michigan students, faculty and staff across all campuses, including Michigan Medicine. This includes those working remotely. More information on this new policy is available on the Campus Blueprint website or the UM-Dearborn and UM-Flint websites. How to Apply
A cover letter and resume are important submissions for the hiring team to get a sense of your experience. In the cover letter, in one page or less, please let us know how you will align with your career aspirations and skills. Submit both a cover letter and resume as one file (because of system limitations).
Competitive salary available based on qualifications, experience and education of the selected candidate.

BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Our Core Values are the standards by which we conduct ourselves day in and day out, both internally and externally.

Infrastructure Services (IS) exists to provide world-class cloud and on-premise infrastructure solutions that enable the firm to realize goals today and well into the future. These infrastructure solutions are highly automated, using the latest technologies with an Agile DevOps Methodology. This is made possible through building a dynamic team of highly motivated engineers and providing them with the latest enterprise tools and training to accomplish a never-ending stream of challenging business needs. The IS team builds the foundations that allow the business to bring new and innovative solutions quickly to market.

The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining an automated delivery process for the provisioning and deprovisioning of infrastructure resources across production, QA, and development environments. In addition, the DevOps Engineer works closely with application architects, developers, and quality assurance to automate and accelerate the testing, release, and deployment of applications both on-premise and in the cloud. The DevOps Engineer will have experience with the core suite of tools used to package, build, and deploy infrastructure resources. They will have additional experience in configuration management tools such as Puppet (or similar) to provide an end-to-end resource provisioning solution.

Since the DevOps Engineer will play a significant role in the organizational wide transformation of IT, cross training, documentation, and mentoring team members is a vital part of the role.
Qualifications
Education:
High School Diploma or GED, requiredBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Analysis, or Information Technology, preferred
Experience:
One (1) or more year of experience designing, executing, and supporting IT automations, requiredTwo (2) or more year of experience designing, executing, and supporting IT infrastructure solutions, requiredExperience with Azure and/or AWS environments, requiredIntermediate-level skill in Azure DevOps processes, preferred
License(s)/Certification(s):
Microsoft Certified – DevOps Engineer Expert, desiredMicrosoft Certified – Azure Administrators, desired
Software:
Prior experience with the below software programs, preferred
PackerTerraformChocolateyPuppetPowerShellGITMicrosoft Windows Server and Active DirectoryLinux OS
Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability and willingness to reverse engineer dependencies and interactions in complex vendor-supplied applications
Comfort with frequent, incremental code testing and deploymentComfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching across teams and all employee levels
Multiple Locations

As a Site Reliability Engineer, your essential job functions will include the following:

Build and maintain application platforms that are reliable, scalable, and performant
Support Application Development teams in the design and development of new applications, ensuring that the designs are reliable, efficient, and optimized to meet the performance needs of the business
Facilitate capacity planning in collaboration with networking, infrastructure, and application development teams
Build and maintain application development systems and processes to facilitate effective change management
Automate and standardize repeatable tasks with software
Develop and execute monitoring strategies to analyze performance trends and ensure rapid issue response
Respond to performance and availability issues for application platforms, and resolve issues in response to reported incidents
Provide on-call coverage for supported applications to ensure performance and availability within service levels
Other Duties as Assigned

Position Requirements

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems and/or a minimum of 7+ years of related experience required
3+ years of experience developing and operating distributed systems
3+ years of Linux server administration
Fluent in at least one programming language (JavaScript/node.js, Python, and Golang preferred)
Experience building and maintaining a Container Infrastructure (Docker, Rancher, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience building systems via configuration as code (Ansible preferred)
Experience administering, monitoring, and performance tuning web application platform technologies, including but not limited to: ngnix, node.js, redis
Knowledge of networking principles and how they relate to the architecture and performance of distributed systems
Knowledge of Scrum Agile Methodologies
Competencies Required

Results Orientation
Agility
Initiative
Influence
Critical Thinking
Customer Focus
Learning Agility

job_title: Expert Security DevOps Engineer - OPEN TO REMOTE
listing_jobDesc:
Team Name:
Job Title:
Expert Security DevOps Engineer - OPEN TO REMOTE
Requisition ID:
R016866
Job Description:
Your Platform
Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB.
Your Mission
Activision, the publisher of the hit Call of Duty franchise, is looking for a passionate Security DevOps Engineer to join our Activision Blizzard King (ABK) Security Architecture and Engineering function. If you are a passionate gamer with a security and systems engineering background, come be a part of our team. The mission of the Security DevOps team is to increase organizational efficiency through technology integrations, and workflow automations, allowing teams to focus on technological innovation and process refinement instead of dealing with highly repetitive activities across physical, virtual and cloud computing. The Sr. Security DevOps Engineer will contribute to the team, mentor and upskill the security engineers; and help define the strategy for supporting the transformation of the whole security department towards a DevOps attitude.
This role reports into the Senior Manager, Security DevOps and maintains strong relationships with all line-of-business technology groups. You will work closely with several key individuals and teams and will be part of a dedicated team of security engineers and architects who demonstrate superb technical competency, delivering critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance and security across our enterprise. Qualified candidates will have a background in IT, computer, security systems analysis and engineering.
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Providing technical leadership and decision making for aspects of Security DevOps across IT programmes and solutions
Identify gaps in our current processes, workflows and design solutions; and recommend changes or enhancements as needed to improve efficiency through automation and scalability
Work with other teams to drive new projects, product implementations configuration reviews, ensuring that best practice standards are maintained
Partner with other security teams to guide them through SRE and DevOps best practices.
Oversee technology procurement choices for automation systems and system controls in partnership with security architecture
Define the gitOps framework for the Security department and provide guidance to other functional areas outside Security
Act as a Tech Leader for the Security DevOps team, influencing team’s technical decisions and goals
Player Profile
Minimum Requirements:
10+ years of experience
Proven experience as a technical leader
Display technical excellence in Cloud Native technologies as well as multidisciplinary capabilities in coding, networking, governance, project management, etc.
Excellent ability to gather requirements, speak to business stakeholders, and deliver results
Thorough understanding of the latest security principles, techniques, and protocols
Ability to problem solve independently and collaborate as a team to solve complex problems in support of the team’s mission
Knowledge of industry best practices for foundational security elements including network devices and system-level hardening
Hands-on experience in gitOps frameworks using tools like ArgoCD, Jenkins, DroneCI, GitLab, GitHub, etc; and infrastructure as code such us Terraform or Ansible
Automation of security workflows
Knowledge of containerization software: Docker, Kubernetes
Extra Points:
Excellent knowledge of cloud security best practices and solutions in cloud security posture management and cloud security workload management.
Knowledge of Identity and Access Management frameworks in cloud environments
Hands-on experience with serverless functions
Hands-on experience with log collection, normalizing, and management; security infrastructure and policies; and risk mitigation
Knowledge about the current security threat landscape and common tactics, techniques and procedures used in offensive security
Knowledge of Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) products.
Knowledge of operating systems and database security
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. COMPANY OVERVIEW: Wondr HealthTM is a digital behavioral change program focused on weight management, which helps participants improve their physical and mental wellbeing through simple, interactive, and clinically proven skills and tools. By treating the root cause of obesity through behavioral science, Wondr reduces risk factors to prevent chronic diseases like diabetes and hypertension, helps enhance employee productivity and engagement, decreases claims costs, and improves overall physical and mental wellbeing.A master class of sorts, Wondr Health’s team of renowned doctors and scientists teaches practical, data-backed skills that empower participants to stress less, sleep better, and feel better. The highly personalized program has helped hundreds of thousands of people by flipping diet culture upside down and teaching employees the science of eating the foods they love so they can still lose weight. Through the app, online community, certified coaches, and series of weekly videos that offer a new perspective on better health, participants enter a world where weight loss is a science, small steps lead to big changes, perspectives are flipped, possibilities are infinite, and good habits last. Learn more at www.wondrhealth.com.PURPOSE:Wondr Health is looking for a DevOps Engineer. The ideal candidate will be an energetic person who will drive how the company deploys, verifies, and monitors applications and services. This person will interface with all stakeholders to define DevOps processes and shape the development culture. This role also assists in the ongoing improvement of CI/CD environment provisioning and development workflows. You will ensure that they have appropriate levels of monitoring and alerting set up for all applications across a mix of physical servers, private cloud, and public cloud.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Build a strong relationship with the development teams to understand the code, its dependencies, and the infrastructure on which it runs.Build and maintain systems that will monitor all aspects of the application and the infrastructure.Assist development team with deployment strategy and capacity planning across development, QA, staging and production environments.Experience building cloud-based infrastructure solutions in AWS with a strong governance model knowledgeWork with the development team to deploy and manage tools that support SDLC automation, configuration management, and release management.Strong understanding and experience operating in an agile development environment.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Experience with source code management tools such as Subversion and Git.Proficiency in cross-platform scripting languages and build tools (Python, ANT, Artifactory, Groovy, Maven, MS Build, Nexus, NuGet).Experience deploying and administering Continuous Integration tools such as Jenkins, TFS, TeamCity or Bamboo.Experience with Infrastructure cloud tools such as Terraform, Docker, Aspire, etc.Sound knowledge of administrative best practices for application servers, database servers and third-party appliances.Experience with automated testing solutions for unit testing, integration testing and system testing.Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language such as Java, PHP, or JavaScriptUnderstanding of strategies for providing high availability and security.Ability to define scalable CI/CD pipelines.Understanding of deployment strategies using Docker for containerization.Strong understanding and experience operating in an agile development environment.QUALIFICATIONS: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent professional experience.Certification(s) - AWS Certification or Solution Architecture Certification is highly desirable.Experience:  3-5 years of experience working Devops EngineerDuties/Responsibilities:DevOps to support the PMM application development work. The DevOps’s responsibilities will include:*Responsible for designing, building and supporting a secure cloud platform and linux based instances based on industry standards, best practices and guidelines*Determine technical standards and specifications and lead the design, build and support of shared services cloud platform components*Providing professional support services and/or the integration of their respective products.*Implement the products based on best Practices*Review the current architectural landscape and make appropriate recommendations.*Must be able to compare various solutions and determine the one which best fits the need.*Designs, develops and maintains linux based instances and backendapplications.*Deploy and maintain web application technologies and middleware solutions on linux platform.*Researches new technologies and products for their applicability to business processes.*Provides tier 1 and tier 2 support for the platform Education:A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline.Experience:*This position requires a minimum of eight (8) years of experience in System administration and development experience*At least file (4) years of experience working with design and implementation of systems and applications at Amazon Web Services (AWS).*Sets up administrator and service accounts and troubleshoot creates/updates and Maintains system documentation, interacts with users and evaluates vendor products, deep understanding of monitoring AWS instances and services*Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform capabilities and best practices architectures, and engineering solutions within multiple Cloud accounts and services*Experience working in AWS via the CLI and management console. Company Description
Advancing healthcare through data science is our mission. Delivering high impact, intuitive technology and analytics is our passion.

We are driven by outcomes. Our tailored healthcare intelligence solutions are central to identifying actionable insights that advance care and improve patient outcomes, drive physician engagement and productivity, and enable success with value-based payment models and CMS quality reporting. We deliver clinically-rich solutions that lead to results that have a real impact on real people.

Job Description
JOB SUMMARY
Sr. DevOps Engineers work collaboratively with Software Engineering to deploy and operate our platform. This includes building and maintaining tools for deployment, monitoring performance trends, troubleshooting and resolving issues in various environments. This is a FTE role (no C2C/C2H.)
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Identify opportunities for automation, quality improvement, and consistency in current ecosystem
Work closely with Software Engineering, QA and System Administration teams to provide a stable, consistent, efficient development and production environment
Creating best-practices to solve real-world software engineering problems.
Own and drive solutions from problem statement to implementation – concept to completion.

Qualifications
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of devops experience in a compliant-focused environment/industry (ie healthcare/HIPAA, finance/ PCI-DSS, insurance, energy, FedRAMP etc.)
Strong cloud computing experience, AWS (preferred), GCP, Azure
Strong systems administration and scripting experience (bash, python, powershell, powerCLI)
Experience with the following technologies/tools/frameworks:
 Containerization (Docker) and container orchestration (Kubernetes)
Kubernetes associated technologies (ie Helm, Ambassador, Istio, etc.)
Automation/configuration management (ansible, Puppet, chef)
 Infrastructure automation (ie Terraform, CloudFormation)
 CI/CD (ie Jenkins, Gitlab, Maven)
Virtualization (VMWare, Hyper-v)
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
 Experience in a blue/green deployment environment a plus
Healthcare and/or analytics experience a plus
Certification (any) with AWS (preferred), GCP, or Azure a plus
Experience working with Java / Spring / micro-services a plusThis is a FT salaried role with benefits.
Additional Information
ArborMetrix has an outstanding entrepreneurial team with a strong mix of clinical analytics, statistical, software and business expertise.
We value creativity, innovation, problem solving, collaboration, and fast iteration, which allows us to continuously improve our platform. Company Description

Responsibilities:

The DevOps Consultant will work directly with the Cloud Ops team and Product/Development team to ensure close collaboration between Development and Operations. The Consultant will serve as a technical expert and will also be an active team member, attending scum sessions, and contribute towards the backlog
Design and implement build, deployment, and configuration management
Test implemented designs
Build and test automation tools for infrastructure provisioning
Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve
Promote proactive monitoring and performance tuning practices
Brainstorm for new ideas and ways to improve development delivery
Consult with peers for feedback during testing stages
Build, maintain, and monitor configuration standards
Meet periodically with Cloud DevOps team members to share challenges and technology trends to ensure a uniform delivery approach across development teams
Assist with standards creation for Cloud Architecture and Deployment in conjunction with the Cloud Ops team to ensure those standards are integrated into software development processes
Strive to reduce manual efforts by replacing with scalable Cloud-native automation
Improve infrastructure development and application development
Follow all best practices and procedures as established by the company
Qualifications:
Minimum of 10 years overall IT/Technology/Operations/Software experience
Strong Experience with Puppet (or Chef, Ansible, or other similar tools)
Strong Azure DevOps knowledge and experience of pipelines
Full lifecycle experience of migrating and automating installation of apps into the cloud
Good interpersonal skills and have the ability communication with all levels of an organization
Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently

Piper Companies is seeking an DevOps Engineer for a scientific research company located on the East Coast. The DevOps Engineer is a contract opportunity with potential to hire and can be fully remote, but would prefer candidates that can commute to the office in Chapel Hill, NC as needed.
Responsibilities for the DevOps Engineer include:﻿
Support group efforts to test, package and deploy software
Design and implement continuous integration/deployment pipeline
Develop data structures and algorithms to support the clients collaborations and research
Requirements for the DevOps Engineer:
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field
Knowledge DevOps concepts, skills with Docker or Singularity, Linux, Jenkins, Bash or Python scripting, Ansible, Kubernetes and Cloud
Compensation of the DevOps Engineer includes: $80,000-$120,000 plus a full comprehensive benefits package

The Company
An investor-backed startup located in the Raleigh-Durham area, Infinia ML enables large enterprises, healthcare innovators, and technology companies to apply machine learning to their unstructured data challenges. Our work is focused on intelligent document processing, where we automate workflows that have traditionally required a human-level understanding of written content. We have developed a flexible, standardized platform for the processing of that written content in documents - think medical records, contracts, invoices, insurance claims, emails, etc.
Our technical team is led by Chief Scientist Lawrence Carin, Ph.D., one of the world’s foremost experts on machine learning.


The Role
Typical activities will include:

Expanding and standardizing our usage of CI in our various projects
Expanding our library of CI templates to solve new problems
Learning about DevOps principles, techniques, and tools
Helping update tools in our stack as new versions become available
Helping remediate security vulnerabilities as they’re detected

Your experience and attributes:

Developed a functional application as part of a project or class
Experience with at least one backend programming language
Deployed an application to a cloud provider like AWS or Heroku
Automated running of tests or deploying of an application using a CI tool
An interest in learning more about our technology stack listed below
An interest in learning more about the software development lifecycle

Technologies we use:

Python and Go
Docker, Kubernetes, Vault, Git, CI/CD
AWS and Azure
Kustomize, Terraform and similar

CivicActions is a mission-minded company. We focus on helping the government deliver better services through modern software practices. We work in cross-functional, agile teams and communicate openly and honestly. We encourage a balanced, autonomous lifestyle. We are looking for others like us with a true passion for using technology to change our world positively.
This position will join our cross-functional and highly collaborative team developing the next generation of NSF.gov, using modern technologies and practices.

This position is remote (work from home) and requires a federal background investigation.

Responsibilities

Break down complex problems into understandable and iterative solutions
Infrastructure-as-code development and operations on Kubernetes environments using Docker and Helm
Continuous integration & continuous deployment with Jenkins
Familiarity with AWS services including EKS, RDS PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch
Create and maintain documentation, timely and detailed ticket updates and communications around work
Planning and implementing migration of systems and applications between hosts with minimal downtime
Can work both collaboratively and solo, with experience navigating complex troubleshooting scenarios

Requirements

At least six years of DevOps, SRE, IT, sysadmin, security, developer or other relevant experience
Site reliability engineering (SRE) and on-call rotation - must be able to respond nights and/or weekends, as necessary
Experience with Infrastructure-as-code development and operations on Kubernetes environments using Docker and Helm
Familiarity with AWS services including EKS, RDS PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch
Experience with continuous integration & continuous deployment with Jenkins
Experience working in Agile and cross-functional teams (with users, developers, product managers, security and compliance)

Nice to have:

Experience working with distributed teams
Experience with GNU/Linux, Apache, PHP and/or Drupal configuration
Previous federal background investigation

Salary Range

$90,000 - $125,000 USD per Year

Salary commensurate with qualifications and experience
Location

We are a completely remote team within the United States. We ask that you have a dedicated workspace and fast internet.

Why CivicActions

People who are well taken care of can be more balanced, productive, and happy.

100% company-paid medical/dental/vision/life/disability with 100% dependent coverage
401(k) plan
Flexible vacation policy
Yearly professional development stipend
Yearly technology stipend

Apply

ComResource is looking for a DevOps Engineer.

This person will be responsible for building and maintaining the platform services that run business applications.

Responsibilities:

Working with development teams to design and deliver infrastructure and platform solutions that meet operational targets for high availability, DR, logging, and monitoring
Installing, patching, upgrading, supporting, managing capacity, and administration of platform services (e.g., WebSphere, Tomcat, NodeJS, Informatica, Layer7)
Utilize Python, Jenkins, and scripting to create pipelines for application delivery
Assisting the adoption and implementation of DevOps and automation for infrastructure services and application deployments
Providing 24x7x365 assistance as necessary in support of operations as part of the team on-call support
Implement proactive monitoring and event management for applications and platform services
Work with development teams and DevOps Engineer Senior and Leads to design and deliver cost-effective infrastructure and platform solutions that meet operational targets for high availability, DR, logging, and monitoring
Assist the adoption and implementation of automation for infrastructure services and application deployments
Ensure application and platform changes are executed successfully with minimal impact on business operations
Participate in IT Initiative projects and assist in project delivery and success
Participate in the effort for migration to AWS/Cloud
Support operational needs by ensuring that SLA targets for system availability are met by constantly improving the detection, prevention, and resolution of system issues
Provide 24x7x365 assistance as necessary in support of operations as part of the team on-call support
Meet SLA targets for requests/incidents to ensure we are meeting the service expectations of our customers
Partner with DevOps Engineer, Senior to become an SME (Subject Matter Expert) for Infrastructure Applications
Take Ownership of a problem/outage and assist the effort to resolve it
Drive the introduction of new platform services that improve our ability to cost-effectively develop and deliver business applications
Address critical infrastructure and platform lifecycle risks
Ensure systems follow best practices for encryption and identity and access management
Adhere to SLAs for patching of critical systems that limits security risks with minimal impact to system availability
Reduce remediation time of critical and high vulnerabilities from 90 to 60 days through enhanced patching methodology

Essentials:

4+ years of experience in Software or Infrastructure role with at least 2 years in a DevOps role

Join a dynamic and growing Technology team at Washington Federal. As a national bank that acts like a reliable next-door neighbor, we are building the expertise to deliver leading, integrated solutions for our consumer, small business, and commercial customers.

We are seeking an energetic, positive, and highly technical DevOps engineer who specializes in automation to assist the IT Department in the adoption of DevOps best practices.

As an IT DevOps Engineer, you'll report directly to the IT DevOps Manager and act as a major engineering contributor for the team. You'll be a technical resource supporting the IT Department's transition to CI/CD, automated Configuration Management, and Infrastructure as Code. This position requires a balance of systems administration, architecture, configuration management, application troubleshooting, customer focus, creativity and relentless enthusiasm. While being a change agent, you'll be an integral part of Washington Federal's proud culture of simply being nice when serving our colleagues and clients.
Primary Responsibilities and Activities
Support and maintain core DevOps tools and platforms such as: Jenkins, Docker, Azure Pipelines, SonarQube, Prometheus, and baseline Ansible playbooks
Support product teams as they modernize applications hosted on containerized platforms
Be an ambassador in the Enterprise, evangelizing and supporting the adoption of DevOps principles and practices
Partner with development teams to understand and help implement their projects so they conform to current industry best practices for builds, deployments, testing and operations
Support and implement automation of manual processes for various IT groups as required
Provide technical guidance and support for cloud infrastructure automation as the Enterprise moves towards adoption
Collaborate with developers to implement best practices during all phases of the SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle)
Keep current on industry-best practices and technology trends
Help develop DevOps KPIs and success metrics
Provide after-hours Production support as needed
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer/Electrical Engineering, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience.
Three years of experience as a DevOps engineer working in an Enterprise environment with heavy emphasis on IaaS and PaaS.
Two years of hands-on experience with AWS and demonstrable history of successful Enterprise-level project migrations and implementation.
Two years of experience with Docker and container utilization/implementation.
Two years of experience with Terraform, Cloud Formation and the concept of IaC (Infrastructure as Code).
Experience in at least one CI/CD platform such as Jenkins or Azure DevOps
Experience with an Enterprise Configuration Management solution such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
Experience with an Enterprise observability tool suite such as Prometheus, DataDog or Splunk
Good time and project management skills, solid oral and written communication skills, and excellent analytical skills.
Two years of experience with at least two scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, bash, PowerShell or Groovy.
Very comfortable in both Windows and Linux environments.
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or related field.
Five years of experience as a DevOps engineer working in an Enterprise environment.
AWS certified Solutions Architect - Associate and/or AWS certified SysOps Administrator - Professional highly desired. Specialty AWS certifications are also desired.
Docker Certified Associate highly desired.
Extensive experience using Terraform highly desired.
ITIL Foundations (or above) certification
Experience with Agile frameworks desired (Kanban, SCRUM, SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework))
Previous experience in a highly regulated industry such as health care or financial services desired.
SOX (Sarbanes Oxley) and PCI (Payment Card Industry) experience desired. Join a dynamic and growing Technology team at Washington Federal. Provide technical guidance and support for cloud infrastructure automation as the Enterprise moves towards adoption
Collaborate with developers to implement best practices during all phases of the SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle)
Keep current on industry-best practices and technology trends
Help develop DevOps KPIs and success metrics
Provide after-hours Production support as needed
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer/Electrical Engineering, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience.
Three years of experience as a DevOps engineer working in an Enterprise environment with heavy emphasis on IaaS and PaaS.
Two years of hands-on experience with AWS and demonstrable history of successful Enterprise-level project migrations and implementation.
Two years of experience with Docker and container utilization/implementation.
Two years of experience with Terraform, Cloud Formation and the concept of IaC (Infrastructure as Code).
Experience in at least one CI/CD platform such as Jenkins or Azure DevOps
Experience with an Enterprise Configuration Management solution such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
Experience with an Enterprise observability tool suite such as Prometheus, DataDog or Splunk
Good time and project management skills, solid oral and written communication skills, and excellent analytical skills.
Two years of experience with at least two scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, bash, PowerShell or Groovy.
Very comfortable in both Windows and Linux environments.
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or related field.
Five years of experience as a DevOps engineer working in an Enterprise environment.
AWS certified Solutions Architect - Associate and/or AWS certified SysOps Administrator - Professional highly desired. Specialty AWS certifications are also desired.
Docker Certified Associate highly desired.
Extensive experience using Terraform highly desired.
ITIL Foundations (or above) certification
Experience with Agile frameworks desired (Kanban, SCRUM, SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework))
Previous experience in a highly regulated industry such as health care or financial services desired.
SOX (Sarbanes Oxley) and PCI (Payment Card Industry) experience desired. Join a dynamic and growing Technology team at Washington Federal. As a national bank that acts like a reliable next-door neighbor, we are building the expertise to deliver leading, integrated solutions for our consumer, small business, and commercial customers.

You’ll be responsible to help support 24x7 uptime and availability of production mission critical customer facing cloud services distributed across multiple regions. You’ll help to create more consistent, automated push button environments across all tiers, proactively test and tune all aspects of the infrastructure, streamline CI/CD processes, monitor and respond to system notifications and alerts and continually work to optimize and improve the performance, security and reliability of our systems.About You: You have a strong mix of engineering, system administration and automation skills. You love improving and streamlining systems and processes and making things highly secure, scalable and repeatable. developing and automating cloud operationsCreate automation to support key development pipelines, process and infrastructureCollaborate closely with the Software Engineering team to design, develop, About Nautilus.

Nautilus is building artificial intelligence to advance the efficiency of ocean commerce. We deliver technology to help shipping companies minimize fuel consumption, maximize operational efficiency, and optimize fleet performance. By arming ship owners and operators with real-time predictive decision support, Nautilus is reducing greenhouse gas emissions and making global trade sustainable.

Ocean shipping consumes over $100 billion dollars of fuel every year, and up to 30% of it can be saved. For owner-operators, reliance on manually collected and analyzed data makes it difficult to optimize fleet performance in real-time. By providing a unified data platform that leverages machine learning, Nautilus helps its clients make better decisions to maximize the return on each ship and every voyage. For our clients, this means they drive closer collaboration, greater transparency, and stronger accountability across their global teams every day.

About you.
We are hiring a DevOps Engineer for our Infrastructure team. We're looking for a team member who wants to make an impact in a mission-driven, customer focused technology company in the maritime shipping industry. You are inquisitive and enjoy solving technically challenging problems. You see DevOps and your role as a critical accelerant for the other Engineering and Data Science teams at Nautilus Labs.

Outcomes For This Role.

In this role, you will perform a variety of functions to ensure that our AWS infrastructure and tooling are available, reliable, stable and secure. To ensure that Nautilus Labs engineering operates in a highly effective manner, you will develop and tune build and deployment pipelines for the Software Development teams and for our Data Science team. You will develop and manage deployment, monitoring and alerting dashboards.

Proficiencies.

3+ years of experience designing and deploying on AWS on an infrastructure team
Solid scripting experience using Python
Solid understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL, and in-memory databases like Redis)
Experience with Docker and ECS/EKS
Experience with CI/CD tools like Circle or Jenkins
Experience with Terraform and/or CloudFormation
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to balance stress, effort, and reward
BS in Computer Science, similar field of study or equivalent practical experience required

Our core values.

Get ready to join a group of diverse, smart, talented, and driven individuals. We are looking for people who are motivated by environmentalism and a future where shipping is sustainable and safe. A team member joining Nautilus is...

We're THOUGHTFUL, with a bias towards action.
We're an INCLUSIVE crew, and we are not passengers along for the ride.
We're DIRECT and we ask the tough questions.
We EMPATHIZE with humanity.
Location: Remote, US

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. About Nautilus.

Brief Role Description
The Software Delivery Engineer will be accountable for building, optimizing and maintaining the tools and services to support enterprise software delivery into production, with the primary goal to support internal and external software development teams in delivering high quality software with speed. This position reports to the Software Delivery Manager in the Information Security & IT group.

Accountabilities
Design and implement Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment pipelines for a range of projects and environments:
Leverages deep knowledge of modern software development practices to design effective pipelines to support software delivery
Collaborates with scrum teams, Information Security, and test engineering to understand requirements and ensures pipelines create efficiency for the entire software development lifecycle
Ensures required quality and security integrations are appropriately integrated into all pipelines and coordinates licensing and utilization for pipeline tools with the Software Delivery Manager
Create and maintain effective documentation on tools and pipelines: The Engineer will create documentation on the architecture, setup and daily operation of CI/CD tools and services and maintain that documentation in an ongoing fashion to ensure that all stakeholders have access to relevant and useful information to support their use of those solutions.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance for scrum teams: The Engineer will be on call for requests for assistance from the various scrum teams leveraging pipelines built or supported by the engineer and will apply expertise both for consulting and hands-on troubleshooting/problem resolution.
Coordinate support activities with external vendors where required for problem resolution
General Responsibilities
Participate in appropriate scrum ceremonies where appropriate
Provide timely updates to management on open issues and projects
Coordinate activities with Information Security and IT teams to ensure availability and security requirements are met consistently.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or a related field or equivalent in work experience.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in DevOps processes, CI/CD implementation, infrastructure automation and quality engineering
Minimum of 3 years of software engineering experience
Demonstrated subject matter expertise in delivery automation for cloud-native services, preferably within AWS
Experience working cross functionally in disparate geographies required
Ability to travel approximately 10% of the time Brief Role Description

Company Description
At GovOS, we believe that government’s potential to do good is largely measured by how quickly they respond to and accommodate citizen needs, both online and off. Evolving out of 30+ years of providing public sector services, GovOS has been built with the mission to accelerate the digital transformation of government. We are committed to being exceptional partners with agencies nationwide as we work together to bridge the growing gap between the analog and digital ages.

Job Description
Work in a cloud operations department that practices a DevOps philosophy. Code isn't thrown over a wall from Development to Operations. Instead, Ops works closely with Dev from before development begins to create efficient, reliable, and cost-effective software. The ideal candidate for this role will strive to exemplify our company core values in all that he/she does: “Own It”, “No Day Wasted”, “Customer Centric”, “Together We Win”, and “Purpose Driven”.
Responsibilities and Duties
Create productive developer workflows (especially using automation)
Design and maintain shared production, development and testing environments
Build and maintain code deployment systems
Respond to on-call emergency response.

Qualifications
Applicant will have extensive experience with:
Administering at least one of Linux, Unix, Windows
Writing with any scripting language (especially Python, shell)
Managing cloud resources (especially AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
Working with configuration management tools (especially Ansible)
Working with continuous Integration tools (especially Jenkins)
Working with metrics tools (especially Prometheus)
Working with graphing tools (especially Grafana)
Moderate experience:
Administering and tuning databases (especially PostgreSQL, SQL Server)
And at least some experience:
Administering at least one of Linux, Unix, Windows
Programming using any programming language
A substantial portion of Operations Department work is customer service (customers are mostly internal to the company). Therefore, a customer-oriented attitude, along with diplomacy and clear communication are strictly required.
We realize almost no one has all of the experience listed above; that's okay. Foundational knowledge plus desire & ability to learn are at least as important as experience.
Additional Information
Benefits:
As a full-time employee, you will receive access to the following benefits
Leadership and career development opportunities
Low cost insurance (medical, dental, vision, life & disability)
401(k) plan (company matching)
Paid holidays
Open PTO - no accruals
Paid maternity & paternity leave
Educational assistance
Business casual environment Company Description

Set Solutions is seeking a Lead DevSecOps Engineer to work remotely. The right candidate for the role is highly motivated by architecting and solving complex technical projects and seeing them come to completion. Core responsibilities include planning, organizing, and supporting agile project teams to deliver projects to completion. This person will work closely with business stakeholders, engineering leaders, and product managers to execute high-impact technical projects.Job Responsibilities Include· Work closely with other developers to enhance infrastructure, improve reliability, and efficiency;· Working closely with our development team to create an automated continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) system;· Be a hands-on contributor and IaC code reviewer;· Mentor junior engineers, evangelize good security habits and secure development practices;· Set then raise the bar, and contribute to best practices for all engineers;· Support team’s Azure upgrade/migration efforts;· Responsible for static and dynamic testing of applications· Streamline the build and deploy pipelines in Azure for the backend team, frontend team, and data team;· Ensure least privilege access to our system and a zero-trust environment prevails;· Lead infrastructure architecture definition and alignment across Engineering teams;· Design and implement infrastructure as code to programmatically build the client platform- with a focus on SaaS;· Take true ownership of our infrastructure, networking, and security;· Provide hands-on technical expertise and support in general DevOps tasks. Responsible for defining and implementing the build, deployment and monitoring standards for this customer;· A part of Agile development teams to deliver an end-to-end automation of deployment, monitoring, and infrastructure management in a cloud environment;· Build and configure delivery environments supporting CD/CI tools using an Agile delivery methodology;· Create scripts and/or templates to automate and/or bootstrap infrastructure provisioning and management tasks;· Working closely with our development team to create an automated continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) system;· Work together with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution;· Monitor and support all installed systems and infrastructure;· Develop custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks;· Contribute to the design of information and operational support systems;· Organize the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability, acting proactively;· Install, configure, test and maintain operating systems, application software and system management tools;· Oversee the company’s security, backup, and redundancy strategies;· Evaluate application performance, identify potential bottlenecks, develop solutions, and implement them with the help of developersBasic Qualifications· Strong understanding of and experience with Azure, CI/CD pipelines, etc.· Experience using SAST and DAST tools for application security testingServices;· 3+ years experience with infrastructure as code frameworks like You can fill these in· Experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases like Redis, MySQL, Graph and DocumentDatabases,· Experience with modern, SOA and micro-services. This is a senior level role, strong communication skills mandatory- ability to talk confidently to all levels of the organization.Key: must have strong Azure Kubernetes background (Azure and Kubernetes must be strong skills, not just something they’ve worked with a little bit).Key: position will be tasked with finding ways to automate/standardize across the enterprise.Must have experience on the support (Monitoring and Alert) side.Any OO coding background a plusBonus if they have some Terraform experience, moving towards an Infrastructure as Code environmentSCOPE OF ROLEThe Lead Software Engineer on The Developer Experience team is laser focused on accelerating our engineering organization. The Lead Software Engineer will act as the point person for initiatives across the organization by helping to build building roadmaps and executing on top priorities, self-managing work and tickets, assist team members in removing roadblocks as they come up, and periodically providing senior management with an overview of performance and initiatives. As Lead Software Engineer you will scour the rest of the software development landscape to bring best practices and proven tools/technologies to our own organization while partnering with our Infrastructure and Site Reliability Engineering teams to foster a DevOps approach to designing lasting enterprise solutions.ROLE RESPONSIBILITIESBuild smooth and efficient processes via automation or internal tooling to empower developers as they ship code through the software development lifecycleWork with our primary stakeholders, Bright Health software engineers, to craft solutions to remove friction in shipping codeEvangelize built solutions so that developers are aware of the improvements they can use in their own workflows, either via written documentation or live demonstrationsScour
